intro: Melicope mahonyi, commonly known as Mahony's melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and smooth, often aromatic bark. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often on rocky or coastal slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
